welcome.title: Welcome to QZPay Playground!
welcome.description:
This is an interactive environment to test all QZPay features.

We'll guide you through:
• Setting up payment providers
• Creating plans and prices
• Managing customers and subscriptions
• Viewing events and state

Let's get started!

sidebar.title: Main Navigation
sidebar.description:
The sidebar is organized into three main sections:

• Setup - Configure templates and payment providers
• Catalog - Define plans, prices, entitlements and limits
• Simulate - Create customers and test subscriptions

Click any item to navigate to that section.

sidebarSetup.title: Setup Section
sidebarSetup.description:
Start here to configure your playground:

1. FIRST: Select a payment provider and click Initialize
2. THEN: Choose a template to load sample data

You must initialize the playground before accessing other features.

providers.title: 1. Payment Provider (Required First)
providers.description:
FIRST STEP: Select and initialize a payment provider.

• Mock (Recommended)
  Test without real credentials
  Simulates all payment flows

• Stripe
  Get API key: dashboard.stripe.com/apikeys
  Use Secret key (sk_test_...)

• MercadoPago
  Get credentials: mercadopago.com/developers
  Your Apps → Select app → Credentials

Click 'Initialize Playground' to continue.

templates.title: 2. Templates (After Initialization)
templates.description:
AFTER initializing, templates appear here:

• SaaS Template
  3 plans (Free, Pro, Enterprise)
  Monthly/yearly pricing
  Feature entitlements & usage limits

• E-commerce Template
  Product catalog setup
  One-time payments

• API Template
  Usage-based pricing
  Metered billing

Templates load sample data you can customize.

catalog.title: Catalog Section
catalog.description:
Define your billing catalog:

• Plans - Subscription tiers (Free, Pro, etc.)
• Prices - Monthly/yearly amounts
• Entitlements - Features each plan unlocks
• Limits - Usage quotas per plan
• Promos - Discount codes

This is where you set up what you're selling.

plans.title: Plans
plans.description:
Create subscription plans that customers can subscribe to.

Each plan defines:
• Name and description
• Features included (entitlements)
• Usage limits
• Available billing intervals

plansList.title: Your Plans
plansList.description:
Here you can see all your plans.

Click on a plan to:
• Edit its details
• View associated prices
• See entitlements and limits

Use the 'Add Plan' button to create new plans.

prices.title: Prices
prices.description:
Set pricing for your plans.

For each plan, you can define:
• Monthly price
• Yearly price (usually with discount)
• Currency

Customers choose their billing interval when subscribing.

entitlements.title: Entitlements
entitlements.description:
Entitlements are features that plans unlock.

Examples:
• 'api_access' - Access to API
• 'premium_support' - Priority support
• 'advanced_analytics' - Dashboard access

Use entitlements to gate features in your app.

simulate.title: Simulation Section
simulate.description:
Test your billing setup with simulated data:

• Customers - Create test users
• Subscriptions - Subscribe customers to plans
• Payments - Process charges and refunds
• Invoices - View billing history

All actions generate real events you can inspect.

customers.title: Customers
customers.description:
Create test customers to simulate subscriptions.

Each customer has:
• Email and name
• External ID (your system's user ID)
• Metadata for custom data

Customers can have multiple subscriptions.

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
subscriptions.description:
Subscribe customers to plans and test the lifecycle:

• Create - Start a new subscription
• Pause - Temporarily suspend
• Resume - Reactivate paused subscription
• Cancel - End the subscription
• Change Plan - Upgrade or downgrade

Each action generates events and updates state.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description:
Process payments and refunds.

• View payment history
• Process manual charges
• Issue refunds (full or partial)

Payments are linked to customers and subscriptions.

header.title: Header Area
header.description:
The header provides quick access to:

• Current payment mode badge
• Panel toggle buttons
• Utility actions (export, import, reset)

Use the panel buttons to show/hide information panels.

panels.title: Information Panels
panels.description:
Toggle these panels to view different information:

• Customers - Active customer list with details
• Reference - Quick API reference
• Events - Activity timeline (webhooks)
• State - Full JSON state inspector

You can have up to 4 panels open at once.

timeline.title: Event Timeline
timeline.description:
Every action generates events shown here:

• customer.created
• subscription.created
• subscription.paused
• payment.processed
• invoice.generated

These are the same events you'd receive via webhooks in production. Use them to understand the billing lifecycle.

actions.title: Utility Actions
actions.description:
Quick actions in the header:

• Export - Save current state to JSON file
• Import - Load a previously saved state
• Reset - Clear all data and start fresh
• Help - Open documentation

Use export/import to save and restore test scenarios.

components.title: React Components
components.description:
Preview the pre-built React components:

• PricingTable - Display plans and prices
• SubscriptionStatus - Show subscription details
• InvoiceList - Payment history
• EntitlementGate - Feature gating
• LimitGate - Usage limit checking

These components work with QZPay out of the box.

complete.title: You're Ready!
complete.description:
You've completed the tour!

You now know how to:
✓ Set up templates and providers
✓ Create plans, prices and entitlements
✓ Manage customers and subscriptions
✓ View events and inspect state
✓ Use React components

Start exploring! Click '?' icons for contextual help anytime.

saas.title: SaaS Template
saas.content:
Includes:
• 3 plans (Free, Pro, Enterprise)
• Monthly and yearly pricing
• Feature entitlements
• Usage limits with quotas
• Sample promo codes

ecommerce.title: E-commerce Template
ecommerce.content:
Includes:
• Product catalog setup
• One-time payment products
• Shopping cart workflow
• Order management

api.title: API Template
api.content:
Includes:
• Usage-based pricing
• API call metering
• Tiered rate limits
• Overage billing

stripe.title: Stripe Setup
stripe.content:
1. Go to dashboard.stripe.com
2. Click Developers → API keys
3. Copy the Secret key (sk_test_...)
4. Paste it in the API Key field

Use test mode keys for development.

mercadopago.title: MercadoPago Setup
mercadopago.content:
IMPORTANT: Use PRODUCTION credentials (not TEST)

1. Go to mercadopago.com/developers/panel
2. Select your application
3. Go to 'Production credentials'
4. Copy the Access Token (APP_USR-...)
5. Copy the Public Key (APP_USR-...)

Sandbox has limitations. With production credentials and test cards, payments are not actually charged.

Use 'APRO' as cardholder name to approve payments.

mock.title: Mock Provider
mock.content:
Simulates payment processing without real credentials.

Perfect for:
• Testing billing flows
• Development and demos
• Learning QZPay

All payment operations succeed by default.
